intro: Pedicularis shanensis var. evrardii, commonly known as the Shan mountain lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred petals and vibrant orange to red flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
